content: For #announce > Mathlib Reviewer Bootcamp, I see the application instructions on the website but I'm not seeing where it says exactly what should be included in the email. Am I overlooking it or is it not mentioned?

Thank you for pointing out the oversight. I have changed the application description to:

To apply, please send an email to yael.dillies@math.su.se with subject
MRB 2026 - Applicant name by 28th February 2026 containing: your review and mathematical interests,
a short summary of your experience with Lean/Mathlib and a few sentences about your motivation.
If you need a visa to visit Sweden, please indicate so in your email.
This is an awesome opportunity - I am going to seek permission from my boss but if I get that I will 100% apply. Honestly, this feels like it would be perfect for me.
What's a "reasonable" amount of travel funding from Europe per person?
With 12 participants, there would be ~2000SEK ~= 200 EUR available for travel per person. With 15 participants, this would go down to ~700SEK ~= 70 EUR per person.

Oh, the flights alone would cost me ~400 EUR :melting_face:
Is there a cheap place to stay in the area?
We would be covering accommodation :wink:
Strangely, trains from London to Stockholm and back are also about 400 EUR if you like that kind of thing :)
I cannot attend this – I am now in my PhD under Frank Stephan
@Yaël Dillies I have already applied but I would ideally like to apply for travel funding - unfortunately for reasons I can't get into travel approval on my current grant can be a little difficult.
If I have to I have some personal funds to draw on but given we are trying to save for a trip to Australia this year for family reasons I would prefer to avoid this
